['Typing: The act or skill of composing text using a keyboard.', 'Finger dexterity: Refers to the agility and nimbleness with which fingers can move across keys.', 'Keystroke economy: A measure of how efficiently one uses keystrokes, aiming for fewer to achieve more words.', 'Cursor navigation: The ability to easily maneuver a cursor onscreen using keyboard shortcuts (e.g., arrow keys).', 'Word processing: Composing and editing text in digital form through the use of software.', 'Typing speed: The rate at which an individual types, measured in words per minute (WPM).', 'Muscle memory: Developed proficiency where muscles automatically execute complex tasks without conscious thought, aiding keyboard technique.', "Ergonomics: The study of optimizing the workspace and equipment to fit the user's needs, preventing strain during composition.", 'Keyboard layout: The arrangement of keys on a keyboard, with QWERTY being the most common for English-language keyboards.', 'Autocomplete/auto correction: Features that predict words as they are typed and correct typos to enhance typing efficiency.', 'Touch Typist: A typist who can type without looking at the keyboard, using muscle memory instead.', 'Posture: The way one sits or stands while composing text; proper posture helps avoid strain during long writing sessions.', 'Precision typing: Accurately hitting individual keys to minimize errors and maintain speed.', 'Finger agility drills: Exercises designed to improve the flexibility and coordination of fingers for better keyboard technique.', 'Palm rest: A piece placed on a desk or surface to support the palms during typing, preventing strain in hands and wrists.', 'Finger tapping: The practice of rapidly alternating between adjacent keys to increase speed (a key part of touch typing training).', 'Cohesion: How well sentences flow together; a crucial aspect for written composition beyond just keyboarding skills.', 'Sight-typing technique: A method where typists learn the location and sequence of keys without necessarily memorizing them, relying on visual cues instead.', 'Composition rhythm: The natural pace at which an individual composes text; this can influence typing speed but also affects readability and writing style.', 'Technique refinement: Continuous improvement in keyboard skills through regular practice, feedback, and adapting to new technologies or software updates.']
